column4: hello there. How can I made a user with limited accesss. So it can only modify ONE directory and in it subdirectorys ?
thats the definition of all users - they can only modify the directories / files they own or are in the group for
what exactly do you want to do?
I want to make a user that can remotely access to ubuntu machine and can upload via winscp some files in this directory...
I don't wannt this user to install or uninstall anything just to copy files on my ubuntu machine or delete BUT ONLY FOR one directory..
just create a new normal user - they wont be able to do anything dangerous to the system, except in their home directory
add a user with the utilities on the menus
and how big would be theri home directory '
as big as the free space on the device you choose for their home directory location (it doesnt have to be in /home). unless you install quota tools
but your system has a gui on it ?
sometimes I also do some GUI things via VNC..
yeah, so create the user in the gui tools - or you can use the useradd / adduser commands
